title: Biotehniški Center Naklo
segmentation: Ladies and gentlemen, dear guest, thank you to join us here at the by Technical center Macklem.
My name is Maria Gregori Ann.
I would like to present you our work as a research unit and also project office.
While research unit advised technical Central nucleus quite young unit, we were established in 2010.
And we already have 22 researchers and actually we work within the higher vocational college.
So what we would like to join here on a biotechnical center naklo first is agriculture.
Then is Environmental Protection.
The third one is education.
Especially we would like to develop elearning not only for our students and pupils, but also for the other farmers.
Um, then research, and of course we want to be a good service or research service for businesses.
For companies, actually we.
And say that we are center of education and innovation.
So what is our main goal in the future?
Actually, we would like to join agriculture and Environmental Protection.
Why is this so becausw nowadays?
Alot of farmers complain that environmental protectors do not understand them and also with the versa.
Alot of environmental protectors will say that farmers are some kind of the past to the Earth.
And actually, our main goal is to develop environmental guardians to join agriculture and ecosystem into agroecosystem.
But before I start with my presentation, I would like to talk about research.
When I ask my students about the research, what do they think about it?
What do they see when I talk to them about the research?
The first thing is this.
Some complicated laboratories hidden somewhere in the cellar.
Doing some some strange stuff with poisonous chemicals, high tech equipment so quite impossible to reach in everyday life.
This is for genius etc etc.
But actually when I.
Ask them, what about the chief in the cook in the kitchen?
He has to be a very good researcher when he wants to be above average.
If he wants to be above average, he must know very good about ingredients, about the herbs that he will be using, so he has to do a very good research.
Couple
Author or artist has to know a lot about the wood.
He has to be a very great researcher if he wants to be above average.
If he wants to develop something you never do.
Yes, every morning girls.
Had to do research.
How to dress?
What to wear actually now days.
A lot of businesses, nearby marketing and so on.
He's doing a great research how to influence the people other people by how do we wear ourselves.
Of course girls do.
Not read scientific papers, but they do research every day and never.
Unless this is Professor Altieri, he's the pioneer on the field of Agroecosystem.
And actually I want to talk here about Agroecosystem in that way that the farmer, if he wants to do something new to develop, he has to do a great research.
In the field of nature, there are so many interactions.
If, for example, if we take a plant, we put a seat in the soil, you have first interaction.
Here you have microorganisms, you have fun.
G mycelium.
You have earth components.
You have soil.
You have all these interactions and when the seat starts to germinate, there is a mycorrhiza.
There's a.
A bacterium that fixed the nitrogen from the air.
So there are so many interactions and also then when the when the plant starts to grow their interactions with the environment with the sun with aerosole with the pollution.
So there here are so many interactions that a farmer has to be actually the greater research of all if he wants.
To be above average again, if he wants to be also at the end self self sufficient.
So now I would like to speak about the good practices here on the ball technical.
Centers we have quite a lot of project running at this time.
So.
These are just few of them.
We work with companies.
We work with European an also Slovenian institutes, research institutes.
We work also with biodynamics institutes.
We also work with pharmacy, so a lot of these government are not governmental.
University Institute research institutes.
Kinds are here are we are joining together and we have now like 2 opportunities.
One opportunities is that we do our research work for them so they come to us to ask for help.
So because we want to be a good service for them.
The other thing is that we join our students with all of these companies with all of these institution and first of all.
We are give them opportunity to do a diploma to do a practical work there, or maybe later.
They will be their employee.
So we would like to join on one side research and another site we would like to encourage students to do research and also in the future to connect with all of these people.
One of the research that we are doing right now.
This is the removal of Rumex alpinus on the mountain color sheets.
And while we do that, becausw rumex alpinus is considered the next suite is actually.
We assume that Rumex alpinus is on this mountain be cause of the.
Clever use of artificial fertilizers and we are doing now.
We would like to remove that and bring Pastor back to this Mount and so here we join agriculture and Environmental Protection because we use integrated management.
Here are the tests plots on this mountain.
We do the full replication.
We also.
One of the one of the test plots was by using domesticated breed of peak.
This is kerska Polski.
Appreciate you in the.
In the past farmers use to pastor do the pastor on the mountains and they usually picks work on the mountains.
This is another test plots and this year results are quite good.
The other project that we are running, it's also organic seed production and saving.
This is with a sweet partner.
Agreed I am.
But we would like to do here is beginning of the awareness why the seat production and saving is so important for Slovenia.
Also, we would like to encourage farmers ecological and bile dynamical farmers to start to grow seeds and also to save them.
Because this is showing a better self sufficient also for Slovenia also we we are now working on the seat storage.
Elaborate because we would like to establish some workbook or something like that that each farmer.
Could read and somehow see that.
Establishing this seed storage facility it's not so hard.
It's just another philosophy how to start this.
And also, um.
Learning how to check the quality so I will go through pictures only.
It'll be here.
We do a germination tests will learn the farmers how to do that so that the end they have a quality seat.
That this seat will germinate.
Also, we do how to we learn how to clean the seat because at the end you have to have clean seats so that we don't have any weeds and so on.
Also, we do experiments on this infection of the seats by different methods, not chemicals, but this is hot water.
These are the medicinal plants.
So how to use this?
Especially biodynamics are quite interested in this procedure, because they use a lot of medicinal plants on their gardens.
This is the collection garden.
This collection garden is also used as a school garden.
We would like to bring our students our pupils out of the classrooms into the nature and one of these projects.
This is not only to learn how to do a simple hybridization, how to save seats, how the plants look like.
This is also a school classroom and also we do not separate seeds from plants from Earth and so on.
This is also a classroom to learn.
The beneficial
Organisms ladybug.
This is one of the beneficial organisms and this organisms helps us to prevent pests on our crops on our vegetables.
So when the students are researching how to how to hibrida Hebridean for research, the hybridization and they do the research about the seat production.
They also learn about the beneficial organisms because without them also the hybridization and the seed production would not be possible.
And also we educate not only our students, our people, our pupils, but we also educate farmers from outside.
Other interests are groups that would like to learn and this is what we would like to contribute to the farmers that the farmers have to research have to do research.
They have to develop all the time.
One of the things is also organic plant breeding.
Now we are doing the research on the banquet on the back with starch quality, but this is done by the organic plant breeding procedures.
So hearing Biotechnical center we are ecological and biodynamic orientated so we do not use any this biotechnology procedure like gene transplant.
And so on.
Also.
School gardens this is bio dynamical school garden.
It's also a classroom for our students to learn how to do things.
We would not like to just show them a PowerPoint presentation and tell them this look like this.
This is like this and this is like this.
We would like to show them in the nature we would like them to feel the soil.

And also the horticulture we have here, a researcher who is doing marketing on ornamental plants in Slovenia, because this is a very a very unknown field in economics and this is quite interesting to be research in the future.
And also we have this year we already had the second scientific conference with international participation called Vivos.
And we also have two professional journals.
These are the more podeszwa import floristic.
So we are very much also involved in this research, but most important in this practical research.
And of course, so many more things are going on here at the center.
But what about in the future?
One of the our main goal is to connect to link with Balkan, an Arab countries.
Besides this one that we already are in connection then we would like to connect with research institution also at the national and international level also.
We would like to link economic economies and enterpreneurs both at home and in Europe and of course to be a good research service for local and foreign companies and.
Also, our main goal again is to work with nature, to research the nature, to observe, the nature, to learn from the nature, and not to be against her.
So.
Thank you very much for your attention.
Have you done a test study field comparing the bio dynamical production and?
Conventional production yes.
This year you will also find this research in this booklet that you have in front of you with done research regarding biodynamics.
When the seedlings when the seats were put into the soil.
Regarding to Maria Tune Calendar on the right time on the node, right time.
This is the first year experiment and the experiment is showing when the plans were put into the soil at the right time or the production was much higher than then.
The time when they were seeding the seats on the not the right time, but for the bigger experimentation plots we are now.
We are now planning to have an experimentation plot here because the soil is problem now.

Experimental plots they have to be reputation and so on, and because we also have a farm here and we also sell our vegetable and products and etc, we now plant where we will have these plots and we will do also these experiments so that we have the repetitions of the statistic is OK and so on.
Yes, that was very inspiring.
Thank you and I do hope that I can see you already oracom University and as from conversations, I hear you become more and more of a University.

I hope you pursue you pursue this communiversity path rather than get into their classical University structure, which stops that potential the the the point and the question I wanted to make his research.
Now I love the way you talked about.
Research is something on the ground, something practical, something every good share for every good gardener does.
On the one hand.
On the other hand, I have a plea that we also see research as philosophy and worldview.
Now it's interesting that if you think of where we are in Slovenia.
Two major major research philosophers.
The one was who sell.
We all know who sell from Moravia.
The others Rudolf Steiner.
They were both phenomenologists, right?
It's no accident that they are phenomenologists the way you described.
Researchers very phenomenological.

What I would add to what you are saying is if we become conscious of pursuing phenomenological research, we will do it in a very different way, not only on the ground but on behalf of our society as a whole.

We call it the relational approach to research because as you know, the research community around the world is dominated by empiricism, so I'm hoping gradually you work with who you are, raise your level of consciousness so you become a model for Slovenia.
And for the world.
Thank you.
Did you try to cooperate with the University in Ljubljana?
And what was the response?
What was the?
Yeah, we do cooperate, but right now we do not have any research projects, joint projects together at the time.
But we cooperate in the meaning of the stuff of the professors and so on.
Yes, we do.
I'm mainly interested because.
Today I'm it's my first time here and when I came here I was surprised how many things is happening here.
I was studying in new Ghana.
It's like.
We are quite young here, so maybe do they do not see us at this time as some serious partner for them, but so that's why we have a lot of European projects.
But lately we gain some trust, so eventually we will also develop some project joint project together also with them.
Thank you very much.
